intro: Harpullia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a tropical plant native to Madagascar. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant features large, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and red. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The plant is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil.
